PROTOCOL ID (Required): A unique ID for the protocol.
PROTOCOL NAME: A short name for the protocol.
PROTOCOL DESCRIPTION: A general description of the protocol.
PUBLICATION DOI: The publication digital object identifier (doi) for the protocol.
PROTOCOLS.IO DOI: The protocols.io digital object identifier (doi) for the protocol.
DOCUMENT FILENAME: A filename of a PDF document containing the details of the protocol.
PROTOCOL TYPE (Required): The name of a process type being used.
PROCESS TYPE ONTOLOGY ID: An ontology term identifier in the form prefix:accession
PROCESS TYPE ONTOLOGY LABEL: The preferred label for the ontology term referred to in the ontology field. This may differ from the user-supplied value in the text field
MARKERS: A list of markers used to enrich for or against certain cells.
MINIMUM SIZE SELECTED: Minimum cell or organelle size passing selection, in microns.
MAXIMUM SIZE SELECTED: Maximum cell or organelle size passing selection, in microns.

PROTOCOL ID (Required): Protocol ID should have no spaces.
PROTOCOL TYPE (Required): For example: enzymatic dissociation; blood draw
PROCESS TYPE ONTOLOGY LABEL: For example: enzymatic dissociation; blood draw
MARKERS: Format as a space-delimited list of markers with +/- where + means enriched for and - means enriched against. For example: CD4+ CD8-; HLA-G+

PROTOCOL ID (Required): FILL OUT INFORMATION BELOW THIS ROW

PROTOCOL DESCRIPTION: Depletion of non-stromal cell types was achieved by MACS separation following the manufacturer's protocol with some modifications. The stromal fraction was enriched by MACS-depletion of CD45+, EpCAM+ and CD235a + cells.
MACS depletion of epithelial and hematopoietic cells was performed as for human stromal cells using in this case antibody-conjugated microbeads to murine EpCAM and CD45.
The resultant cell suspension was passed through a 70 Î¼m cell strainer.
